identificationModule.briefTitle: Safety and Efficacy of SHPL-49 Injection in Participants With Acute Ischemic Stroke
identificationModule.officialTitle: A Multicenter, Randomized, Double Blind, Placebo Controlled Phase II Clinical Study to Evaluate the Safety and Efficacy of SHPL-49 Injection in the Treatment of Acute Ischemic Stroke

descriptionModule.briefSummary: This study is designed to determine the safety and efficacy of SHPL-49 intravenous infusion for 7 consecutive days in the treatment of acute ischemic stroke subjects.
descriptionModule.detailedDescription:
Trial Objectives:

The primary objective of this study is to determine the effectiveness of different doses of SHPL-49 intravenous infusion for 7 consecutive days in the treatment of acute ischemic stroke subjects within 8h after onset.

The secondary objective is to determine the safety of different doses of SHPL-49 intravenous infusion for 7 consecutive days in the treatment of acute ischemic stroke subjects within 8h after onset.

Trial Design:

This study is a Phase II, multicenter, randomized, double Blind, placebo-Controlled design. Participants receive twice daily dosing for 7 consecutive days, or once on Days 1 and Day 8 and twice daily on Days 2 to Day 7, with each subject scheduled to receive 14 doses throughout the clinical trial. 270 Participants will be randomized 1:1:1 to SHPL-49 injection treated group (3 ampoules of SHPL-49 injections, BID), SHPL-49 injection treated group (6 ampoules of SHPL-49 injections , BID) and placebo group (BID).

interventions.name: 3 ampoules of SHPL-49 Injection
interventions.description: 3 ampoules of SHPL-49 Injection in 100 mL 0.9% sodium chloride will be administered as a 30-minute IV infusion and applied twice daily for 7 days.

interventions.name: 6 ampoules of SHPL-49 Injection
interventions.description: 6 ampoules of SHPL-49 Injection in 100 mL 0.9% sodium chloride will be administered as a 30-minute IV infusion and applied twice daily for 7 days.

interventions.name: 0.9% Sodium Chloride Injection
interventions.description: 100 mL 0.9% sodium chloride will be administered as a 30-minute IV infusion and applied twice daily for 7 days.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Modified Rankin Scale (mRS), with scores of 0-1 at Day 90
primaryOutcomes.description: Proportion of participants with mRS scores of 0-1 at Day 90

secondaryOutcomes.description: A shift of one or more categories to reduced functional dependence analyzed across the whole distribution of outcomes on the mRS at Day 90

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Modified Rankin Scale (mRS), with scores of 0-1 at Day 30
secondaryOutcomes.description: Proportion of participants with mRS Scores of 0-1 at Day 30

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Modified Rankin Scale (mRS), with scores of 0-2 at Day 30
secondaryOutcomes.description: Proportion of participants with mRS Scores of 0-2 at Day 30

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Modified Rankin Scale (mRS), with scores of 0-2 at Day 90
secondaryOutcomes.description: Proportion of participants with mRS Scores of 0-2 at Day 90

secondaryOutcomes.measure: National Institute of Health stroke scale (NIHSS) on day 7or 8
secondaryOutcomes.description: The proportion of participants with NIHSS scores of 0-1 or with ≥4 point reduction from baseline on day 7 or 8 (after the completion of the final dose)

secondaryOutcomes.measure: National Institute of Health stroke scale (NIHSS) at Day 14 or at discharge
secondaryOutcomes.description: The proportion of participants with NIHSS scores of 0 to 1 or with 4 points reduction from baseline on day 14 or at discharge
Proportion of participants with Barthel index ≥95 at Day 30
Proportion of participants with BI ≥95 at Day 90

secondaryOutcomes.measure: National Institute of Health stroke scale (NIHSS) at Day 14 or at discharge
secondaryOutcomes.description: Changes in NIHSS scores from baseline at Day 14 or at discharge
Symptomatic intracranial hemorrhage within 36h after thrombolysis (Safe Implementation of Thrombolysis in Stroke-Monitoring Study Criteria)
Serious adverse events over the 90-day study period
Adverse events over the 90-day study period
Changes in laboratory test indicators on day 7 or 8(as of the end of the last dose), at Day 14 or at discharge, and at Day 90

secondaryOutcomes.measure: Changes in vital signs before and after administration
secondaryOutcomes.description: Changes in vital signs on day 7 or 8 (as at the end of the last dose), at Day14 or at discharge , and at Day 90
Abnormal 12-lead electrocardiogram over the 90-day study period
Abnormal vital signs over the 90-day study period
Abnormal results of physical examination over the 90-day study period
Abnormal laboratory test indicators over the 90-day study period
